questions.question: What is the primary purpose of 16S rRNA gene sequencing in microbiome research?
choices: To identify and classify bacteria in a sample
To determine the functional capabilities of microbes
To detect viruses in a sample
questions.answer: To identify and classify bacteria in a sample

questions.question: Which of the following is a limitation of 16S rRNA gene sequencing?
choices: It is too expensive for large-scale studies
It requires specialized equipment not available in most labs

questions.question: What is an advantage of whole-genome shotgun metagenomic sequencing over 16S rRNA sequencing?
choices: It provides both taxonomic and functional information
questions.answer: It provides both taxonomic and functional information

What does ASV stand for in microbiome analysis?
Which of the following is NOT a type of diversity analysis in microbiome studies?
What is the main challenge of implementing microbiome research techniques in a resource-limited setting like Timor-Leste?
choices: Limited access to sequencing facilities and bioinformatics expertise
Lack of microbial diversity in the population
Absence of health issues related to the microbiome
questions.answer: Limited access to sequencing facilities and bioinformatics expertise

questions.question: Which of the following is a potential application of microbiome research in Timor-Leste?
choices: Studying the impact of traditional diets on gut health
Analyzing the microbiome of arctic animals
questions.answer: Studying the impact of traditional diets on gut health

questions.question: What is a key ethical consideration when collecting microbiome samples in Timor-Leste?
choices: Obtaining informed consent and respecting cultural sensitivities
Maximizing the number of samples collected
Prioritizing foreign researchers over local scientists
Focusing only on economically valuable microbes
questions.answer: Obtaining informed consent and respecting cultural sensitivities

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a step in the whole-genome shotgun metagenomic sequencing process?
What is the primary purpose of using primers in 16S rRNA gene sequencing?
choices: To target and amplify specific regions of the 16S rRNA gene
To extract DNA from the sample
To identify the functional genes in the microbiome
questions.answer: To target and amplify specific regions of the 16S rRNA gene

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the relationship between 16S rRNA gene sequencing and whole-genome shotgun metagenomic sequencing?
choices: They are complementary techniques often used together in microbiome research
They are mutually exclusive techniques that cannot be used in the same study
16S rRNA sequencing has completely replaced metagenomic sequencing
Metagenomic sequencing is always preferred over 16S rRNA sequencing
questions.answer: They are complementary techniques often used together in microbiome research

questions.question: What type of information can be inferred from metagenomic sequencing data?
choices: Metabolic pathways and functions of the microbial community
The exact number of bacterial cells in a sample
The age of the microbes in the sample
questions.answer: Metabolic pathways and functions of the microbial community

questions.question: Which of the following is a potential challenge in analyzing metagenomic data?
What is the primary advantage of using 16S rRNA gene for bacterial identification?
choices: It contains both conserved and variable regions
It is only found in pathogenic bacteria
It is present in all living organisms
questions.answer: It contains both conserved and variable regions

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical application of microbiome research techniques?
choices: Studying the impact of diet on gut health
Investigating the role of microbes in soil fertility
Exploring microbial communities in extreme environments

questions.question: What is the main purpose of clustering sequences into OTUs in 16S rRNA analysis?
choices: To group similar sequences that likely represent the same or similar bacterial species
To separate sequences from different samples
To determine the total number of sequences in the dataset
questions.answer: To group similar sequences that likely represent the same or similar bacterial species

questions.question: Which of the following is a key consideration when designing a microbiome study in Timor-Leste?
choices: Relevance to local health issues and environmental conditions
Maximizing the use of expensive equipment
Focusing only on gut microbiome samples
Prioritizing research questions of interest to foreign researchers
questions.answer: Relevance to local health issues and environmental conditions
